model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Neighbors B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Neighbors A: I just visited this amazing new city. The architecture was stunning, the streets were so clean, and the people were very friendly.
Neighbors B: Sounds like you had a great time! Which city did you visit?
Neighbors A: It was Chicago. I had never been before, but it exceeded all my expectations.
Neighbors B: I bet it was a nice change of scenery from our neighborhood.
Neighbors A: Definitely. But you know, it's interesting how much our neighborhood has grown on me over the years. I remember when I first moved here, I was so unsure about it.
Neighbors B: Yeah, I remember. But you stayed because you wanted to be here.
Neighbors A: That's right. And since then, I've made so many great memories here. It's become my home.

MEMORY:
Neighbor A has been living in the same place for a long time and enjoys the neighborhood and people there. This has led to Neighbors A valuing the relationship with Neighbors B and considering them like family. As a result, Neighbors A is excited to explore the neighborhood and make new friends. 

Neighbor A and Neighbor B appreciate each other as good neighbors and have organized a block party together in the past. This has caused Neighbors A to enjoy living in the neighborhood, feeling comfortable and safe, and has made good friends, including Neighbors B. The value of the relationship with Neighbors B is highlighted, and Neighbors A appreciates having friendly faces around and hopes to make new friends soon. 

Neighbor A has been living in the same place for a long time and enjoys the neighborhood and people there. However, Neighbors A just moved to a new neighborhood and is getting to know the area.
